tests.explanation: The original program counts both positive and odd elements in the array x. The mutant code starts the loop counter at 2 instead of 0, which means it skips x[0] and x[1], and only counts odd or positive elements from x[2] onwards. This causes the mutant code to miss counting -3, which is an odd element. Hence, the outputs differ.
Both original and mutant programs correctly count that there are no positive or odd elements in the input array.

Both original and mutant programs correctly count that there are 4 positive elements in the input array. However, the mutant code starts the loop counter at 2 instead of 0, which means it skips x[0] and x[1]. Since all elements in this input array are even, the skipped elements do not affect the output. Hence, both programs output the same value.
